title: Ivan Albright Retrospective
description: This exhibit was a retrospective of Ivan Albright’s career. He became internationally acclaimed with his painting “Picture of Dorian Gray.” Albright has been compared to the ‘old masters’ and is generally known for his abstract portraits that are characteristically rife with symbolism. The exhibit included several of Albright’s well known works, including “Poor Room,” “The Window,” and “The Door.” The exhibit included 39 paintings, 5 lithographs, 4 drawings, 5 sculptures, and some of Albright’s medical notebooks.
